intro: Pugionella angustifolia, commonly known as narrowleaf sandparsley, is a flowering plant native to arid and semi-arid regions of North America. It is a member of the Apiaceae family, characterized by its finely divided leaves and small, yellowish-green flowers. The plant typically grows in sandy or gravelly soils and is adapted to thrive in harsh, dry environments. Its leaves are narrow and lance-shaped, and it produces small, clustered flowers that bloom in late spring or early summer. Pugionella angustifolia is often found in disturbed areas and is considered a hardy, drought-tolerant species.
